intro: Coffea spathicalyx, commonly known as the Java coffee plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that contain the seeds used for coffee production. It thrives in humid, shaded environments with well-drained soil. Due to its unique flavor profile, it is considered a rare and valuable species in the coffee industry.
